akn:section.akn:heading: Sexually transmitted diseases; prevention and control projects and programs

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Technical assistance to public and nonprofit private entities and scientific institutions

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Technical assistance to public and nonprofit private entities and scientific institutions The Secretary may provide technical assistance to appropriate public and nonprofit private entities and to scientific institutions for their research in, and training and public health programs for, the prevention and control of sexually transmitted diseases.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Research, demonstration, and public information and education projects

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Research, demonstration, and public information and education projects The Secretary may make grants to States, political subdivisions of States, and any other public and nonprofit private entity for—
(c) Project grants to States The Secretary is also authorized to make proj­ect grants to States and, in consultation with the State health authority, to political subdivisions of States, for—

(d) Grants for innovative, interdisciplinary approaches The Secretary may make grants to States and political subdivisions of States for the development, implementation, and evaluation of innovative, interdisciplinary approaches to the prevention and control of sexually transmitted diseases.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Authorization of appropriations; terms and conditions; payments; recordkeeping; audit; grant reduction; information disclosure

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Authorization of appropriations; terms and conditions; payments; recordkeeping; audit; grant reduction; information disclosure

(f) Consent of individuals Nothing in this section shall be construed to require any State or any political subdivision of a State to have a sexually transmitted diseases program which would require any person, who objects to any treatment provided under such a program, to be treated under such a program.
